aws::graph::propositions: # Amazon Fulfillment Network Operations and Challenges
Amazon's fulfillment network productivity is affected by regional labor market constraints.
Regional labor market constraints increase payroll costs for Amazon.
Regional labor market constraints make it difficult for Amazon to hire a sufficient number of people to operate its fulfillment network efficiently.
Regional labor market constraints make it difficult for Amazon to train a sufficient number of people to operate its fulfillment network efficiently.
Regional labor market constraints make it difficult for Amazon to deploy a sufficient number of people to operate its fulfillment network efficiently.
Amazon maintains inventory of other companies under some commercial agreements.
Maintaining inventory of other companies increases the complexity of tracking inventory for Amazon.
Maintaining inventory of other companies increases the complexity of operating Amazon's fulfillment network.
Amazon's failure to adequately predict seller demand for storage may result in Amazon being unable to secure sufficient storage space.
Amazon's failure to adequately predict seller demand for storage may result in Amazon being unable to optimize its fulfillment network.
Amazon's failure to adequately predict seller demand for storage may cause unexpected costs to Amazon's business.
Amazon's failure to adequately predict seller demand for storage may cause harm to Amazon's business reputation.
Amazon's failure to properly handle other companies' inventory may result in Amazon being unable to secure sufficient storage space.
Amazon's failure to properly handle other companies' inventory may result in Amazon being unable to optimize its fulfillment network.
Amazon's failure to properly handle other companies' inventory may cause unexpected costs to Amazon's business.
Amazon's failure to properly handle other companies' inventory may cause harm to Amazon's business reputation.
The inability of other businesses to accurately forecast product demand may result in Amazon being unable to secure sufficient storage space.
The inability of other businesses to accurately forecast product demand may result in Amazon being unable to optimize its fulfillment network.
The inability of other businesses to accurately forecast product demand may cause unexpected costs to Amazon's business.
The inability of other businesses to accurately forecast product demand may cause harm to Amazon's business reputation.
Amazon performs inventory fulfillment services on behalf of other businesses.
Amazon relies on a limited number of shipping companies to deliver inventory to Amazon.
Amazon relies on a limited number of shipping companies to deliver completed orders to Amazon's customers.

text:
For example, productivity across our fulfillment network is affected by regional labor market constraints, which increase payroll costs and make it difficult to hire, train, and deploy a sufficient number of people to operate our fulfillment network as efficiently as we would like.

Under some of our commercial agreements, we maintain the inventory of other companies, thereby increasing the complexity of tracking inventory and operating our fulfillment network. Our failure to adequately predict seller demand for storage or to properly handle such inventory or the inability of the other businesses on whose behalf we perform inventory fulfillment services to accurately forecast product demand may result in us being unable to secure sufficient storage space or to optimize our fulfillment network or cause other unexpected costs and other harm to our business and reputation.

We rely on a limited number of shipping companies to deliver inventory to us and completed orders to our customers.
